vehicles.description: At the crossroads, multiple vehicles can be seen, including cars, a bus, and a tricycle loaded with goods and carrying a rider, all stationary due to the traffic signal. These vehicles are spread across several lanes, all with their headlights on, indicating that it is nighttime.
vehicles.explanation: These vehicles are road users, autonomous vehicles must be cautious to avoid collisions and safely pass through intersections. Autonomous vehicles must consider the positions of surrounding vehicles to maintain a safe distance, and be prepared for traffic flow. Tricycles, since they share the lane and move in the same direction as autonomous vehicles, directly affect the movement of autonomous vehicles.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Pedestrians are crossing the street, moving from the right side to the left of my vehicle, and there are also those moving from the left to the right; some people are very close to the trajectory of my vehicle, even in front of the stopped cars.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Pedestrians have the right of way, and vehicles must wait for them to pass safely. Since pedestrians may be on the road and could cross in front of vehicles, it is necessary to monitor their safety.

traffic lights.description: The traffic light ahead shows red for vehicles in the same lane as our car, while it shows green for the crossing traffic. The visible traffic lights display red on multiple lanes as well as in the distance.
traffic lights.explanation: The red traffic light indicates that this vehicle and other vehicles moving in the same direction must stop. This vehicle must come to a complete stop and may only proceed when the green light signal is given.

driving_suggestion: Vehicles should remain stationary at red traffic lights and when pedestrians are crossing the road. Due to the presence of pedestrians on the crosswalk and the tricycle ahead, cautious driving is required. Vehicles should monitor changes in traffic lights and may only proceed when the light turns green and pedestrians have safely reached the opposite side. It is advised to maintain a safe distance from the vehicle ahead to allow sufficient reaction time in case of sudden traffic changes. Drivers should be prepared for the possibility of the tricycle stopping abruptly or moving slower than other vehicles after the light change. Vehicles should also ensure that headlights and brake lights are functioning properly for visibility to other vehicles. Once the traffic light turns green and the pedestrian crosswalk is clear, vehicles can cautiously resume driving, being mindful of the positions of other vehicles at the intersection.

1.description and explanation: A group of pedestrians is crossing the street, pulling a cart. These individuals are sharing the road with vehicles but seem to be using an undesignated crossing area. The ego car must slow down or stop if necessary to ensure their safety and yield the right of way, as pedestrians have priority in many traffic regulations, especially when they are already on the road.
